title: Inauguration Guide: Schedule of Events, Performances and How to Watch
sub_head: Organizers have planned a mix of in-person and virtual events for the start of Joe Biden’s presidency
body:
President-elect Joe Biden’s inauguration will look different than past presidents’ because of the coronavirus pandemic. Organizers have planned a mix of in-person and virtual events for the start of his presidency.
Mr. Biden will be sworn in as president at the Capitol on Jan. 20. The ceremony usually takes place around noon.
The program will be carried live by most networks and on the Presidential Inauguration Committee’s social-media channels.
“America United” Welcome Event: The inaugural committee will host an event with some musical performances and celebrity appearances. The participants include actress Whoopi Goldberg, actor Nik Dodani, actress Cristela Alonzo, and actor and musician Darren Criss. The event will stream from 7-8:30 p.m. EST at bideninaugural.org and on the committee’s social-media platforms.
“We The People Concert”: The committee will host a virtual inaugural concert, hosted by Keegan-Michael Key and Debra Messing.
